author: Justin O'Boyle
text: 'I go here very often for lunch and get their Soy Garlic. Very friendly people great food'

author: Vanessa W
text: 'Best chicken around. Love sweet spicy flavor!'

author: DD
text: 'Not sure if this is a legit Korean Fried Chicken restaurant. The drumstick and wings both lack flavor. They are good
column5: but lacks a bit of flavor. The sweet spicy flavor also lacks spiciness which is a bummer for people like me who actually enjoy spicy foods in my opinion. I can‚Äôt say much about the service because I ordered online for pickup. Upon arriving
column6: my order was ready which was good I guess for a Friday night order. I‚Äôll probably give it another shot next time I‚Äôm in the area.'

author: Lisa Marie Zapata
text: "I love the soy garlic wing. They're crispy and well seasoned. It's not everyday that I pick up a box from chicken factory but every time I do
column5: it's a delight."

author: Auston
text: "Absolutely delicious!! Perfectly crispy as you'd expect from Korean fried chicken and the fries are equally as good!!"

author: Joemy Assaf
text: 'Crack Chicken! Need I day more? It is a small place but they deliver and the lunch special is perfect. $10 for portion control rice
column5: cold slaw and wings...soy garlic or spicy or half/half. Delicious üòã never disappoints.  Lunch special avail but not on the online menu.'

author: OPFOR SQUAD
text: 'Great food Everytime.'

author: Atiqa Ghouse
text: 'Great food with non-spicy and spicy flavors wings üëå and great lunch special options üçó its clean and delicious!!'

author: Marina Havriliak
text: 'Wonderful little place with tasty food and friendly service. Will definitely go back again and again'

author: Tim Stead
text: 'Great wings!'

author: Adriel '
text: "The serving size is fairly large but I have a few big issues with this place. The menu is limited to like 5 different things
column5: prices jump from lunchtime to dinnertime and the chicken wrap that I ordered had no real flavor whatsoever
column6: it's as if they didn't season the chicken before they cooked it. The fries however
column7: were really crispy and the sauce you get with every order makes the food tolerable."

author: Connie G
text: 'Delicious
column5: crispy

text: 'Chicken was delicious üòã'

author: Roy Lee
text: 'Best fried chicken in hoboken with really friendly service!'

author: Maurice S
text: 'korean bbq at this place - excellent. Had a sister come into town and asked me to take her here again. This place has an awesome feel to it.'

author: Manouchka Ali
text: 'The food is always good. The chicken is always on point and delicious . My salad was fresh and well prepared'

author: Eduardo Lowery
text: 'Korean BBQ at this place - very good. service is always super even when they have a full house. the staff was very friendly and attentive. this place has a nice atmosphere. food is like a place in baltimore i loved.'

author: Trinanjana Mandal
text: 'Ordered chicken bibimbap through uber eats
column5: it was okay
column6: nothing great. I prefer gogi grill. It is possible that by the time uber eats delivered the food it was already semi cold and did not taste good as a result. Being close to nyc and the great korea town restaurants have spoilt us. This does not compare.'

author: Carmelita Flores
text: "B E S T!!! fried chicken üçó. There's a 20 min wait but its so worth it!. Definitely
column5: please give them a try. You won't regret it!"

author: Young K
text: "Amazing Korean spicy chicken! It tastes authentic and flavorful. It's our go-to food when wanting some quick and easy dinner."

author: Grace Casale
text: 'Delicious food
column5: even better service..'

author: Juan Huerta
text: 'This place gets only 3 stars because food needs a little more flavor. I have tried korean fried chicken at other places and are much better. Food is very "simple and mediocre " for the price. I tried the wings and drums ....I got 2 big pieces of drums and the rest looked like pigeon legs.... yeah that tiny!!!....'

author: W X
text: 'Low quality'

author: Jesica Boyoung Park
text: "It was best chicken ever!\nThey're very kind and chickens are very crispy and tender üòã"

author: Rachel
text: 'DELICIOUS CHICKEN!!!! So yummy and kind workers. Probably the most best chicken place in Hoboken!!'

author: Chavaz Macey
text: 'I come to this superb restaurant many times because I like the ambiance that is part of this place. The team is extraordianrillyremarkably loving and qualified. The service is impressively efficient. Not to mention
column5: the food they cook is exceptionaly good. I visited often and I was never disappointed. The rate is fair. I recommend this place to to all.'

text: 'Best Korean food around'

text: 'I had soy garlic chicken this morning for the first time. Taste was great.'

author: Sandy Smith
text: "This is good chicken & the cole slaw is the best I've had."

author: Thao vo
text: 'The wings are too dry and small. Not juicy at all. I ordered three times  from here and both times it was dry and small wings... so disappointed
column5: I guess I need to order from boom boom chicken .. they are much more juicer and bigger bigs'

text: 'Amazing food...super polite staff'

text: 'Delivery driver is extremely unprofessional . Chicken was also scrawny. Avoid avoid'

author: Gary BART
text: 'Ordered food. Was given wrong food by delivery driver. Then delivery driver texts me cursing at me and calling me a thief bc he made a Mistake!? I called the store and they apologized but didn‚Äôt even say they would fire him. He said I hope you order again. Do not order from this place they‚Äôre extremely unprofessional.'

text: 'A little bit over cooked'

author: K G

author: Jodi Miller
text: 'We ordered sweet potatoe noodles with vegetables and bulgoki. Very disappointing because there was no meat at all.'

author: Dennis W.
text: "This is a copy cat of BonBon Chicken
column5: that famous Korean fried chicken fast food outlet.  Located on Washington St in the heart of Hoboken's main thoroughfare
column6: this place does a decent version of the sweet
column8: chicken wings and drumsticks.   They have other Korean specialties... But we've never seen an Asian working here
column9: so don't expect authentic tastes.  Prices are decent... While the service is bland."

author: John Peralta
text:
'(Translated by Google) Delicious highly recommended chicken flavor

(Original)
Delicioso muy recomendable el sabor del pollo'

author: Ry D‚ÄôLessio
text: 'If you\'re too lazy to take the path for AUTHENTIC Korean Fried Chicken in NYC
column5: this PLACE IS THE CLOSEST spot for your famous Soy Garlic wings. Although
column6: I\'ve had better quality as far as flavoring and batter. The only downfall about this restaurant is the wait time. Normally
column7: "KFC" will take about 35-40 minutes (even less) to make at other korean restaurant . Whoever is cooking in the back makes the wait a little longer. I once waited over an HOUR for a small batch of fried wings and THIS WAS NOT A DELIVERY OPTION. Be prepare for the wait time. Don\'t be surprised if you wait longer than 45 minutes but it\'s worth the wait once you feast! If you can\'t wait that long
column8: CALL AHEAD! I honestly forgot to call ahead since I thought it wouldn\'t be that bad of waiting around. Learned the hard way.\n\n** if you like your wings extra crispy
column9: don\'t be afraid to say so. The lady who owns this restaurant is extremely nice! She listens to every feedback! **'

author: hae kim
text: 'Wonderful authentic Korean-style chicken place! Fresh food and friendly service. I always visit this place to pick up hot spicy chicken whenever I visit Hoboken. Strongly recommended!!'

author: Gwen Thorpe
text: 'The food is here is the best'

author: Gordon Myers
text: 'Big mistake. Where did they get these scrawny chickens?  Heavy coating and rather greasy.  Totally disappointed and just over fried til the meat filled with grease.'

author: Charles Zwicker
text: "I'm a huge fan of their chicken here
column5: and the lady who works here is always very nice.\nPSA: you can get half soy garlic and half sweet spicy if you're stuck between them or looking to split with someone."

author: David Wilson
text: 'I spent the last five months in SE Asia where I became obsessed with Korean fried chicken
column5:
so I‚Äôm really happy Hoboken ‚Äî not known for having very interesting restaurants in general ‚Äî has this place. The food isn‚Äôt earth-shattering but it‚Äôs exactly as it should be for a cheap-and-cheerful chicken place.

Had the spicy fried and it was delicious. Will definitely be ordering whenever I get a craving for Korean fried chicken.

üëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª'

author: Katie
text: "Really tasty Korean fried chicken - both the regular and spicy are great
column5: though the other stuff on the menu leaves a bit to be desired.\n\nBe warned that the spicy sauce - while not excruciatingly spicy - is sticky and will burn the skin around your mouth if you don't eat neatly."

text: 'Best chicken in Hoboken hands down'

text: "Chicken is great
column5: they just have to fix menus when you walk in. You can't tell what is what"

author: sunghee kim
text: "It's the only and the best Best korean style fried chicken in hoboken. It's great for delivery but no mood to dine in..  Try soy garlic and spicy w extra sauce on the side."

author: Ora Ora Ora Ora
text: 'Great chicken.'

author: Brett Hladczuk
text: 'Someone who came in after me took the order that should have been mine
column5: so I waited for over 30 minutes... if that guy is reading this
column6: I have some not so friendly words for you. Other than that
column7: this place was top notch. The wings were perfectly crispy
column8: and the garlic-soy sauce on them was just enough
column9: not overbearing or underwhelming. They were a bit understaffed but the service was very friendly and hardworking
column10: and they even gave me a free drink when they found out I had waited so long. I‚Äôll be coming back here.'

text: 'Really dank food..the beef is amazing too don‚Äôt let the title fool you'

text: 'Best Korean fried chicken I have eaten !! Fries are delicious and crispy too and the garden salad is also really good !!'

text: "Why didn't I get here sooner!!! Great food

text: "Really crispy wings with right amount of sweet and spicy sauce made this one of the best wings I've ever had. The wings seemed to be made fresh too! Also this is the amount of wings present in their small pack which is quite a lot. So keep that in mind when ordering."

author: Max Polun
text: "The chicken is great. Bibimbap is more of a rice salad
column5: but good. Can be a little slow if you don't order ahead."

author: Edward Monero
text: 'The chicken tastes good...'

author: Timothy Auyeung
text:
"Never ordering from this place again.....ordered at 8:25 and it is now 10:06 and their store is supposedly closed by now and they still haven't delievered. If I could cancel the order I would but it was ordered online.

BonChon from Grove St would have been better and faster!

Update its 10:10 and they finally delivered cold french fries and half warm wings.

We ordered a large and small wings with fries and it took 1hr 45 minutes.

This is a disgrace to the food profession and they should be ashamed of themselves for even saying they delivered.

Note to EVERYONE don't order here!! Bonchon from Grove St is much more deserving of our money!"

author: Chris Shimmin
text: "Service was kinda slow but I'll be back for the fried chicken! So good."

author: Domenick Amato
text: "This place has good food - not great
column5: but good.  Where it fails dramatically is in customer service.  My first time was in person and the woman behind the counter was pretty much annoyed that I had questions.  She was dismissive and seemed more interested in watching her baby sleep in the cradle behind the register than serving me.  It was early afternoon - I was the only person there.  I went for a twenty minute walk only to come back and find my order was only half prepared.  I figured it was a glitch but then she literally threw my food at me like she could not be bothered.   I figured I'd try again another time so I ordered in.  The guy on the phone was polite and
column7: my order was perfect.  Tonight we ordered via GrubHub.  The notifications showed that our food was on its way.  A half hour after it was supposed to have arrived - nothing.  We called the place directly and the dreaded lady was there.  I pressed her and she blamed it all on GH but I wasn't buying it.  She finally caved and admitted our order had not been processed or cooked yet!  One hour and forty minutes later and not even processed!?!?  Rather than apologize and offer to make good she got rather defensive on the phone and slammed it down on me.  I call Grubhub and they were appalled and stated the restaurant had been negligent in it's notifications.  I had people over on a Saturday night so I had no choice but to wait rather than cancel.  GrubHub called her and I don't know what they did but we got a call from her 2 minutes later profusely apologizing and she told us our food would arrive within 15 minutes.  It did.  Grubhub followed up and offered me a deep discount on our order.  I am in no way being sexist but that woman is a horror and really brings the place down.  She needs to either step up or step out.  Again
column8: the food is fine but not spectacular enough to warrant the inconsistent and rude service you get.  They must rely a lot on Stevens students because with ordinary clientele they are tone deaf - well
column9: at least she is.  I will never order from there again."

author: Ian
text: "Some of the best chicken I've ever had
column5: it's not very heavily breaded and very crisp. The two flavors they offer are both great and you can't go wrong with either of them.  The only points of consideration are that the wait can be 30-45 mins for prep and the food can be a bit pricey. All things considered it's definitely worth it and some of the best chicken I've had."

author: Myles MacRae
text: 'The fried chicken is top notch.'

author: Shinice Lezama
text: 'HORRIBLE DELIVERY SERVICE!!!!! I waited an hour and a half for some wings!!'

author: Shouyuu Sembei
text: 'The food is delicious
column5: but the service is frustrating. I\'ve walked in 30 minutes before closing to be told they wouldn\'t take my order because it was too late. I tried to order delivery and was told I was too far
column6: by one block and they were too busy to bring the food.\n\nOther restaurants don\'t have these problems. Chicken Factory needs to figure out how to serve customers better. When I want food from them I\'m beginning think the answer will likely be "no."'

author: Peter Kim
text: "As a Korean American who lives in Hoboken
column5: I'm torn about giving this place a poor review because this is the only Korean-ish restaurant in Hoboken and I wish there were more.\n\nBut as much as I tried to like them
column6: I just didn't enjoy my experience there. The chicken was okay. We got a mixed drumstick/wing plate. I think the wings are better because the proportion of batter to meat is probably higher and you get more of the tasty flavoring. The chicken was pretty good but it not as good as Kyochon.\n\nAt first
column7: I thought the chicken was overpriced but when I got through my meal
column8:
I was pretty full so it's deceptively filling.

The bibimbap was pretty bad compared to ones you'll find in Koreantown. I would not recommend it unless you really can't eat anything else.

I thought the eating experience at the restaurant was pretty poor. They should give people hand wipes since it is chicken. Also
column9: even though it wasn't an extremely hot day
column10: it was still fairly warm and they didn't seem inclined to turn the A/C on
column11: which made me think they were really cheap and stingy.\n\nI think I'm going to avoid this place and just drive up to Fort Lee or go to Manhattan for Korean food."

author: Sam Hui
text: 'Horrible delivery service. Waited more than one hour and chicken still not here
column5: despite $2 delivery charge + tips.\n\nAVOID!!!'
